title: Structured Logging Channel Definitions
description: Standard channel/category definitions for Unreal Engine Structured Logging. Channels group related events for filtering and analysis.

AI.description: AI controller lifecycle, behavior tree execution, decision-making
use_cases: Debug why AI doesn't respond to game state changes
Diagnose behavior tree node execution order

Perception.description: AI perception events (sight, hearing, stimulus detection)
use_cases: Debug why AI doesn't see collectibles
Analyze perception range and FOV effectiveness
Trace key value changes over time
Identify which service/task modified a key

Flight.description: Broom flight mechanics, stamina, velocity control
use_cases: Debug stamina synchronization between player and AI

GameMode.description: Game mode state machine, match flow, agent registration

Synchronization.description: Cross-system communication, delegate binding, observer pattern events
use_cases: Debug why controllers don't respond to game mode events

Collectibles.description: Pickup interactions, channel requirements, inventory changes
use_cases: Debug why AI can't collect items

BroomComponent.description: Broom component lifecycle, input handling, physics

UI.description: Widget lifecycle, delegate binding, HUD updates
use_cases: Debug UI not updating when game state changes

Match.description: Quidditch match-specific events (goals, team swaps, scoring)

custom_channels.description: Projects can define custom channels in DefaultStructuredLogging.ini

granularity: Channels should represent logical systems, not individual classes
Group related functionality (e.g., all AI perception events in 'Perception')
Avoid over-fragmentation (don't create a channel per actor class)
filtering: Use focus mode to capture multiple related channels during testing
Set per-channel verbosity to reduce noise (e.g., AI=Display, UI=Warning)
Disable verbose channels in config unless actively debugging
naming: Use clear, descriptive names (Perception, not Percep or P)
Match existing UE_LOG categories where applicable for consistency
Avoid abbreviations unless widely recognized in the codebase
